intro: Sterrhymenia, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, showy flowers that bloom in the evening. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a weed in some regions.
